text: Metahuman for Unreal Engine continues to
evolve the Metahuman suite of products,
offering new capabilities and features
in various areas, including creation,
animation, and styling. This video
covers a highle look at the latest
features including the in-editor
capabilities, access to community
metahuman assets on fab and additional
animation features that improve the
quality and workflow of the metahuman
pipeline. Originally accessible by a
browser, the metahuman creator workflow
moves into the editor with Unreal Engine
5.6, six, enabling you to create and
author Metahuman characters directly in
the editor by using the new Metahuman
character asset. To get started, make
sure you have the Metahuman Creator core
data installed within your Epic Games
Launcher Engine version and then you are
ready to effectively enable the
Metahuman Creator plugin inside your
Unreal Engine project. From there,
simply rightclick in the content
browser, create a Metahuman character
asset, and doubleclick the new asset to
start creating. Within your asset
window, you have access to the original
intuitive face authoring tools, which
now have extended to bodies as well. The
new parametric body system enables you
to create a range of plausible body
shapes based on extensive realworld scan
data that you can sculpt and blend
between. Under hair and clothing, you
can now use your own Metahuman
compatible groom and clothing assets
directly in Metahuman Creator. Meaning
you can author meshbased clothing in DCC
apps and use the new Unreal Engine
outfit asset to generate wardrobes for
your Metahumans that automatically
resize against your characters body
shapes. From the new parametric body
system to the mesh to metahuman
workflow, creators can enjoy higher
fidelity and realism for their
characters like my character here. To
see what is possible, check out the
newest set of characters provided for
your use or simply for inspiration as
you build your own metahuman. Once you
have your Metahuman character customized
as you'd like, you can assemble the
character by creating its rig and
downloading its textures and then
selecting assemble.
You have four options available for
assembling your character based on your
pipeline needs from highfidelity
cinematic quality to optimize options
for UE and UEFN as well as dcc exports.
The ways you can use your metahumans
have expanded. Once your character is
assembled, a blueprint can be found in
the Metahuman folder of your content
browser and is ready to be brought into
your scene. To bring your character to
life, you now have many options for
animating. Let's first take a moment to
understand the different options and
then dive into each one. First off, you
have realtime options from any audio
device, mobile device using the LiveLink
face application, or mono video camera,
which includes webcams and is new to
Unreal Engine 5.6. six. Additionally,
you can create animations offline from
depth data captured with a true death
camera on an iOS device or a stereo
headmounted camera. And lastly, as
additional offline options, you can
generate animations from imported mono
video or audio. Now, let's take a closer
look at these different animation
solutions to better understand how they
work and when to use each solution.
Let's begin with real-time workflows.
With Metahuman Animator, you can capture
an actor's facial performance and turn
it into animation on any Metahuman in
real time using almost any camera. New
to Unreal Engine 5.6 is the ability to
use mono video in real time, including
your webcam, making it easier than ever
to have quick animated feedback with
little setup, as seen with this
Metahuman and my laptop's webcam here.
This real-time process utilizes the Live
Link hub and can work with webcams,
iPhones, audio only, and more. This will
give you the quickest animation results.
Perfect for live performances and is
nice for prototyping and testing. Next,
let's take a look at the offline
options. Using Metahuman Animator, you
can generate Metahuman performance
assets by ingesting mono video using
footage captured previously with
LiveLink Hub and the capture manager
editor. You can also use Metahuman
Animator to generate facial animation
rigs from audio soundwave assets that
are imported directly into Unreal
Engine. When solving audio only offline,
Unreal Engine now includes plausible
head motion [clears throat] and allows
you to influence the mood. These offline
options allow creators and talents to
work asynchronously and come with
additional functionality during the
process workflow. For the highest
quality animation that reproduces every
nuance of an actor's facial performance,
you can use the Metahuman depth
processing plugin in combination with
Metahuman Animator. This workflow
requires either an iPhone with a depth
sensor or a stereo headmounted camera
system and utilizes true depth data to
bring more realism and precision to your
Metahuman animations. This workflow
requires a few extra steps but will
produce the highest fidelity animation
solution.
Once you have your animation pipeline
determined, you can preview character
animations in Metahuman Creator or
animate the character placed in a level
while editing.
Looking for an outfit for your Metahuman
character? Check out the new Metahuman
channel on the Fab Marketplace, which
allows you to buy and sell metahumans
and metahuman compatible grooms and
clothing. This is made possible by a
validation and packaging tool called the
metahuman manager that is provided in
Unreal Engine. Once you find what you
are looking for, simply download and add
the asset to your project. Lastly, there
are new plugins for Maya and Houdini,
making authoring Metahumans across your
pipeline easier than before. Both
plugins have groom starter kits
available on Fab to help get you up and
running. With the many updates to
Metahuman, impressive quality and
uniqueness for characters are easier to
produce than ever before. Try it out for
yourself. Additional resources can be
found in the description of this video
to help support your Metahuman journey.
